title: Top 10 Sporting Venues I've Visited
name: Top 10 Sporting Venues I've Visited
description:
A Map by Volsfan87

This map is designed to show the top ten sporting venues that I have visited during my brief life.

properties.name: Ben Hill Griffin Stadium
properties.description: Posted by Volsfan87The Swamp was crazy place, as last year me and some of my buddies went down to the UT, Florida game. Those people are crazy down there!

properties.name: Busch Stadium
properties.description: Posted by Volsfan87250 Stadium Plaza, Saint Louis, MOHad great seats at a Cardinals game when my buddies and I went on that road trip to Chicago and St. Louis. Great ball park even though I hat the Cardinals, and now they have a World Series victory too.......

properties.name: Coleman Coliseum
properties.description: Posted by Volsfan87TuscaloosaGreat place to watch a college basketball game. Went for the UT, Alabama game last year....and they were crazy in there. I guess it was a good thing that some of our friends that let us sit in the student section with them insisted on us not wearing orange, because it would have been miserable down there, but all in all was a great atmosphere.

properties.name: LP Field
properties.description: Posted by Volsfan871 Titans Way, Nashville, TNThis is the only NFL venue that I have been to, and in my opinion it is a great time if you want to see an NFL game.

properties.name: Neyland Stadium
properties.description: Posted by Volsfan87To me, this is the mecca for college football. You got the Vol Navy coming in on boats, the Vol Walk, tail gaiting all day long throughout campus. And then the game of course. The atmosphere is A+ all the way.

properties.name: Notre Dame Stadium
properties.description: Posted by Volsfan87South BendWent to the UT, Notre Dame game last year and it was very fun. The fans up in South Bend are a lot nicer than they are at some of our SEC schools.

properties.name: Riverfront Stadium
properties.description: Posted by Volsfan87, , OHThis is where I attended my first ever Major League Baseball game and got to see my favorite team, the Chicago Cubs, play.

properties.name: Turner Field
properties.description: Posted by Volsfan87Atlanta, GAI\'m not a Braves fan, but I did get to watch a game here. It was a good time, although the crowd was fairly small for the game I attended.

properties.name: Vaught-Hemingway Stadium
properties.description: Posted by Volsfan87Oxford, MSGood place for college football. Also, awesome tail gaiting and just all around good atmosphere. They like to party down at Ole Miss.

properties.name: Wrigley Field
properties.description: Posted by Volsfan871060 W. Addison St, Chicago, ILHoly Cow! It may say I was born in 1987....but I honestly think I was born the day I walked into Wrigley Field for the first time to watch my beloved Cubs. Me and my three best friends from high school had taken a road trip after our senior year, and made a trip through St. Louis and Chicago. Being a Cub fan my whole life and finally getting to see the green outfield ivy and everything the park had to offer was just surreal. So we went and saw a game and it was probably the best game of the whole year as the Cubs won the game in the bottom of the 9th inning. I had such a good time that I went back two days later and scalped a ticket for like 60 bucks and went to the game while my friends were out in the town. It was awesome!
